page.title: 02OKEFORD FITZPAINE
page.content:
Okeford Fitzpaine is a pretty village surrounded by green hills. It lies in the middle of the {Blackmore Vale}. There are many signs of early human settlement in the area ,including {tumuli}and{field systems}.
The village is made up of some very picturesque old cottages, many still thatched and dating back to the 18th century and beyond. There is a small village school,a church,a Methodist chapel, a village hall, a shop and Post Office and a Public House.
Because of the charming nature of the village centre, it was designated a {"conservation area"}in 1974, and this has successfully retained the essential character of the village.
